qas.question: Who is seeking minority status from the government?
Where would they be represented if minority status is granted?
How are Africans classified in the Arabian Peninsula?
What types of communities have been reported in Iraq?
Who gave information on how blacks were classified in the Arabian Peninsula?

context: <a3_0>Distinctive and self-identified black communities<a3_0/> have been reported in countries such as Iraq, with a reported 1.2 million black people, and they attest to a history of discrimination. <a0_0>African-Iraquis<a0_0/> have sought minority status from the government, which would reserve some seats in <a1_0>Parliament<a1_0/> for representatives of their population. According to <a4_0>Alamin M. Mazrui et al.<a4_0/>, generally in the Arabian Peninsula and neighboring countries, most of those of visible African descent are still classified and identify <a2_0>as Arab<a2_0/>, not black.
